title: AI fever turns Anguilla’s “.ai” domain into a digital gold mine
description: Tiny island country could rake in 10% of its GDP in domain sales this year.

title: Federal health dept. says marijuana should be downgraded to Schedule 3 drug
description: If DEA accepts HHS's rescheduling recommendation, it could ease marijuana access.

title: First Qi2 chargers look to expand MagSafe-like wireless charging beyond Apple
description: Qi's successor could make 15 W wireless iPhone charging more available, too.

title: AI-powered hate speech detection will moderate voice chat in Call of Duty
description: "ToxMod" will automatically flag spoken harassment, bullying, and discrimination.

title: 30 years after Descent, developer Volition is suddenly no more
description: Funding troubles for parent conglomerate Embracer Group continue their ripple effects.

title: Russia targets Ukraine with new Android backdoor, intel agencies say
description: "Infamous Chisel" has been targeting armed forces fighting Russia's military.

title: Pornhub wins injunction that blocks Texas age-verification law
description: Texas was supposed to start enforcing the law tomorrow.

title: Alexa and Google Assistant fall on hard times, agree to be speaker roommates
description: JBL's speaker runs both assistants, but aren't both of these products in trouble?

title: ReiserFS is now “obsolete” in the Linux kernel and should be gone by 2025
description: A little-used file system named for a convicted murderer is slated for removal.

title: Hands-on with Mario Wonder, which freshens up one of Nintendo’s oldest formulas
description: Not using the New Super Mario Bros. name is a subtle statement of intent.

title: Giant worms go wandering in man’s innards, cause dangerous traffic jam
description: Up to 1.2 billion people have these worms, but they usually lie low in the intestines.

title: High-speed AI drone beats world-champion racers for the first time
description: University creates the first autonomous system capable of beating humans at drone racing.

title: X (née Twitter) wants to collect your biometric data and employment history
description: X to collect more user data as Musk teases plan to offer video and audio calls.

title: Impressions: Starfield’s sheer scale is already giving me vertigo
description: Hundreds of planets, hundreds of quests, but is there anything worth seeing?

title: Exclusive: X violated its own policy by blocking First Amendment group’s ads
description: The ads were blocked in error, according to X.

title: Space junk is on the rise, and no one is in charge of cleaning it up
description: There are at least 100 bags of human waste on the surface of the Moon.

title: Dealmaster: Labor Day discounts on Steelcase chairs, LG OLED TVs, Lenovo laptops, and more
description: It's a good time to buy a Steelcase office chair, which is now 15% off.

title: Google removes fake Signal and Telegram apps hosted on Play
description: Before linking an account, be sure the app you're using is legit.

title: Dog autism? 37% of US dog owners buy into anti-vaccine nonsense
description: For the bazillionth time, vaccines do not cause autism—and dog autism is not a thing.
